review_text: Great place for children of all ages to run, jump and play!

Found this place after going to pho75 with my 16 month old daughter. I've been to many parks around the city and I would say that this one is one of my favorites. The park has a field and a very nice play area of the kids. There are tables where you and sit and watch your kids play. I like this park cause its surrounded by houses and not near traffic in any kind of way. I always see parents hosting birthday parties here and its just nice overall. There is a dirt/sand pit filled with trucks and shovels for kids to play. Additionally there are bikes/toy cars for kids to play with.

I love that this park has a core bored for those who need to utilize low tech AAC.
The park was fun for my 3 year old but had nothing to engage my 9 month old ( like swings) .
Cute little playground with a great jungle gym, paths to scoot or bike and lots of shade
We had a nice time getting together here.
Great place for young kids. Race track with shared toys and dog free green space

Great little hidden gem. Lots of age appropriate play equipment, no swings. Lots of climbing and slides for younger toddlers and older children. Place for children to ride bikes. Picnic tables and plenty of benches for parents. Grassy areas to put a blanket down to read books. Separate area to walk pets. Lots of trees shade the playground/sitting areas on those hot summer days. So glad we were introduced to this cool playground. My daughter's favorite playground

Last Saturday, our granddaughter had her eighth birthday celebration at Gold Star Park.  It's between 6th and 7th Street on Wharton in Philly.  On summer weekends people put up tables and sell crafts and collectibles.  Further into the park, there is playground equipment.  There's a kind of "run" around the park for bikes and scooters too.  And there is room for parties.  There are no bathrooms at all, and parking is hard to find.  Plan on walking a block or so to the park from the car.  Once you arrive at the park, it's accessible, although there are no benches.  Either bring your own chairs or plan to sit on the grass.  There is also no food for sale.  Nevertheless, it's an ideal park for a young person's party or even a romantic lunch (you brought), on the grass.

This park has the right balance of attractions to suit all citizens. Accessable area to stroll around and rest on seats situated midst lovely tall leafy trees which provide shade from the suns glare. Picnic tables, a mini bike or running track and play zones suitable for little tots and children aged up to twelve years of age. Definitely a very precious and much used social asset situated in the heart of the local community.
Fun little spot for families & kids. Seconds as a comedy club. Get a good laugh & see what's in the public library.

I love this park! Great for the kids to play! It's always very clean and the times I've been it's not really packed. Someone also left a few toddler ride on toys which is awesome for the little ones. Oh, and they also have a small place (like a small cubicle)  where you can take/leave a book. The park has a few benches, and picnic tables so you can sit and watch your kids play.

The 2021 park improvements are a great addition to this neighborhood gathering place. The upgraded park still welcomes leashed dogs. (They're regrowing the grass area for the dogs-only section).There are 2 big playground units with picnic tables, slides, swings and room to explore. When we visited, the softcover track was busy with kids on trikes or just running laps. The park offers library programs and special programs seasonally. It is a cool shady destination with several lush grassy areas for a picnic or for sitting on a park bench. The mural is by David Guinn (Mural Arts artist) across the street from the park.
The upgrades are phenomenal! So fresh and so clean üëå

City did a wonderful job creating a play space in Gold Star.  Retains it's old character, but with substantially upgraded structures.  Neighborhood has lots of smaller children, 0-5 range, and playground is well suited for them.  That said our 7 and 10 year old have enjoyed it as well.  Caution, there are peak times where playground can be quite crowded. Overwhelmingly, parents and kids are masked and mindful of others.
